Articles.Content: I can see it if I right click on it and open it in a new tab.

> 
> Testing [http://imgur.com/GiGbqh5](http://imgur.com/GiGbqh5)
> can you guys see the image? I can't.

Nope I cant see it.

> 
> Nope I cant see it.

Well, I guess it kind of works. posting images is a painfully slow process, so I won't be posting many. I'll probably just take pictures of my screen. But here is the Ares V so far.

[AdPzVj3](http://imgur.com/AdPzVj3)

First stage has a hidden mainsail and four skippers + 2 AreSRBs (3 SRBs clumped together)

> Well, I guess it kind of works. posting images is a painfully slow process, so I won't be posting many. I'll probably just take pictures of my screen. But here is the Ares V so far.
> ![a>]()

dude just put this AdPzVj3 between the Imgur tags.

I'm 70% done with my Ares V, I need to do the fairings, fix details, and update to 1.0.4, and fly it. And I'm the 404th reply...

UPDATE: darn it, the bottom 1st stage kinda just jolts out of place and explodes right after liftoff in 1.0.4. :I

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-03T22:05:56Z" title="07/03/2015 10:05  PM" data-short="9 yr">July 3, 2015</time> by SaturnianBlue**
Idea! Could I adjust the thrust values of the nuclear engine in it's cfg file, so burns are less painful?

It is not my thread, but i in general dislike editing parts for personal needs, as the mission and craft cannot be recreated by other players, unless they tinker with their game too. Would be a reason for me, not to download the craftfile f.e. Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Just an opinion. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> It is not my thread, but i in general dislike editing parts for personal needs, as the mission and craft cannot be recreated by other players, unless they tinker with their game too. Would be a reason for me, not to download the craftfile f.e. Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Just an opinion. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Oh, I just meant for testing purposes, I would change it before release to make sure it works on a stock game.

> 
> Idea! Could I adjust the thrust values of the nuclear engine in it's cfg file, so burns are less painful?

I think that's a step too far. If you are unhappy about the burn times, just use another more powerful Lv motor. Kat did for his constellation mission. That's a much better solution to editing the game files.

Edit,

 Ninja'd by MRS. If its just for testing, go nuts.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-07T01:51:45Z" title="07/07/2015 01:51  AM" data-short="9 yr">July 7, 2015</time> by SaturnianBlue**
Wow, lookin' good, Saturnian! Question: Is anyone going to use the Asteroid Day mod in their builds?

> 
> Wow, lookin' good, Saturnian! Question: Is anyone going to use the Asteroid Day mod in their builds?

If it's made stock I will see if it can improve anything. If not, its just another mod.

> 
> Thank you!

you're welcome! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Welp, I've built Altair, and my Ares V, I guess it is time to move on to the SPR, and properly do a mun mission. Also MRS, feel free to add me to the list of those in the constellation pack ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
> [http://imgur.com/a/evYtI](http://imgur.com/a/evYtI)

Looks very nice! That EDS looks good however it's replicated. \*Drools\* I will add you to the list, sorry I missed you before!

> 
> Wow, lookin' good, Saturnian! Question: Is anyone going to use the Asteroid Day mod in their builds?

Nope, I don't want to have to teardown one of my craft if it isn't integrated.

I tweaked the nuke's thrust up to 1,000, and... WOW! So much less boring! I'm thinking of releasing it as a mod, here's the WIP page: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/128071-OP-nukes-for-testing-purposes](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/128071-OP-nukes-for-testing-purposes)

Finally back to work, I accidentally deleted some mods before the planned "De-tweakscaling" Process. My two constellation Duna landers broke. So kids, here's a tip: Check if any of your important crafts use a mod you're about to delete. Also, for a stock build, don't use mods.

I played around with paint.net and wrote random stuff in the meantime.

Back to rebuilding the landers.

EDIT: In Japa- I mean, East Serachioa right now. Yeah. For a week. With no laptop.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-11T13:54:15Z" title="07/11/2015 01:54  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 11, 2015</time> by Rolanvorxariat**

Hello fellow constellation-ites,

 Here's a thing. Some pics of my first rebuilt Copernicus. It was heavily based on my first one. It looks super cool but not much like the real proposed Copernicus. It wasn't in three parts for one thing. That is why I have completely rebuilt it to look exactly like the real one. I will show that one soon too. 

 ![2ebd9ht.jpg](http://i60.tinypic.com/2ebd9ht.jpg)

![2m7xock.jpg](http://i60.tinypic.com/2m7xock.jpg)

MJ

Ooh, I have some really cool non constellation stuff to show you guys too. Look out for that.
So that's what amounts to a prototype for your real one?

> 
> So that's what amounts to a prototype for your real one?

At first I wanted to use the 3m White parts and make a constellation alike. An attempt at something refreshing. 

 I decided I wanted it to look more like the real proposed one. The majority of the one shown are as they where in the first pack I made. The transfer stage is different as is a few up front bits. The new one is a complete redesign.

I'm not planning on making my DTV the star of my pack, I'm aiming at a low-part-count usability, with it looking like it, but now exactly perfect.

The stars of my pack are going to be the landers, and orion, if the fairing clipping bug is fixed. The ares rockets are going to look right, but I don't think they're super beautiful.

What's going to be your best of the pack?

> 
> i'm not planning on making my dtv the star of my pack, i'm aiming at a low-part-count usability, with it looking like it, but now exactly perfect.
> The stars of my pack are going to be the landers, and orion, if the fairing clipping bug is fixed. The ares rockets are going to look right, but i don't think they're super beautiful.
> 
> What's going to be your best of the pack?

***everything.***

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-15T20:43:59Z" title="07/15/2015 08:43  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 15, 2015</time> by Zucal**

> I'm not planning on making my DTV the star of my pack, I'm aiming at a low-part-count usability, with it looking like it, but now exactly perfect.
> The stars of my pack are going to be the landers, and orion, if the fairing clipping bug is fixed. The ares rockets are going to look right, but I don't think they're super beautiful.
> 
> What's going to be your best of the pack?

Lol Zucal.

 Umm, the landers probably. Then the SPR and DTV and the rest.

Still silently tweaking things in the background. I have 20 minutes/day time slot for Constellation things, and recently, It's been spent on Altair building, testing, scrapping, and redesigning, as well as ranting for stock 5m parts.
